io.leonis.algieba.calculus

Interface LocalLinearLineIntegral

  • All Superinterfaces:
    LineIntegral, ParametricLineIntegral, ReferenceFrame
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GaussianPotentialField, HydrodynamicPotentialField

    public interface LocalLinearLineIntegral
extends ReferenceFrame, ParametricLineIntegral
    The Interface LocalLinearLineIntegral. This interface represents the functionality of an object which represents a continuous function whose values are computed through a basis transformation and for which a line integral, with a linear path, can be calculated by single variable parametrization.

      • getLineIntegral

        default double getLineIntegral(org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray lowerBound,
                               org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray upperBound)
        Specified by:
        getLineIntegral in interface LineIntegral
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - The lower bound of the integral.
        upperBound - The upper bound of the integral.
        Returns:
        The value of the line integral between the supplied lower and upper bounds (assumes the field to be conservative, which is implied by the existence of the force vector).
